page.title: 05LAND HUSBANDRY ON MARK MOOR
page.content: Grassland is all permanent pasture occasionally ploughed for re-seeding. Farmyard manure plus nitrogen is used for fertilization. Conservation of grass in the form of Hay & Silage for winter feeding. Silage has become popular owing to unpredictable weather. Hay is baled and stored in Barns. Silage is stored in clamps or large plastic bags. Most Farmers use some chemical additive to aid fermentation. Products are threefold, milk, meat & wool from the sheep. The grassland is of such quality it enables intensive production, without feeding expensive concentrates. Weed Control is of prime importance. The land is unstocked in the winter & the pastures sprayed with chemicals in the Spring to kill any unwanted weeds.
